cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 mi N of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW across the Gulf, forecast to turn NW then NNW toward the Texas-Louisiana coast and then curve north-northeast through AR/MO/TN
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX-LA border (around Cameron-Lake Charles area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge watch San Luis Pass TX to Ocean Springs MS; Hurricane watch Port Bolivar TX to W of Morgan City LA; Tropical-storm watch S of Port Bolivar to San Luis Pass TX and Morgan City LA to Mouth of Mississippi River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings for western Cuba, lower Florida Keys, and Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact zone from upper Texas coast across southwest and south-central Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly winds possible late Friday into Saturday (20-30 mph, locally higher in squalls); below tropical-storm force.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1-2 inches of rain possible as remnant circulation passes southeast of Kansas City, with localized heavier pockets.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential river rise on the Missouri and Kansas Rivers from upstream rainfall; debris and drift hazards for barge traffic.
